noun.description: A family of languages spoken by a number of South American Indian peoples inhabiting areas of the upper Amazon basin in eastern Peru and neighbouring parts of Bolivia and Brazil.
A member of a Panoan-speaking people.

adjective.description: Of, relating to, or designating (any of) the Panoan-speaking peoples.
Of, relating to, or designating this family of languages.

origin: Early 20th century; earliest use found in Encyclopaedia Britannica. From Pano + -an.
